newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Jilted Colombian lover torches house, killing six.
newsitem.headline: Jilted Colombian lover torches house, killing six.

text.p: A young man on Colombia's Caribbean coast doused a fisherman's home with gasoline and set it ablaze early on Friday, killing all but one of the seven people trapped inside, authorities said.
Police in the port city of Barranquilla said the attacker, who remained at large, was apparently enraged because a young woman who lived inside the house had spurned his advances.
"He had been rejected on repeated occasions by a young woman who lived there," a senior police official told local radio.

He identified victims of the blaze, which was particularly intense because fuel tanks for a fishing boat had been stored inside the house, as three adults and three children, the youngest of whom was just 4 years old.
Franciso Cano, the only survivor of the blaze, said everyone was fast asleep when it engulfed the house in the pre-dawn darkness.
"It didn't give us time to do anything," he told the Radionet news station from his hospital bed in Barranquilla. "It's a miracle that I managed to get out alive."
